intro: Glandularia elegans, commonly known as the elegant glandular, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the tribe Melampodieae within the sunflower family, Asteraceae. The plant is characterized by its glandular hairs, which secrete oils and contribute to its aromatic properties. Its small, showy flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in summer. Glandularia elegans is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
